title: Quiz

questions.question: In `-rw-r--r--`, which part refers to group permissions?
questions.explanation: Permissions are user/group/other in that order.

questions.question: On directories, execute (x) primarily allows...
questions.explanation: Directory execute means you can access entries inside (traverse).

questions.question: A symbolic link is best described as...
The sticky bit on a shared directory typically means...
choices: users can delete only their own files
questions.explanation: Sticky bit prevents users from deleting others' files in shared writable dirs.

content:
Quiz: Files & Permissions

  1. What do the three permission classes (u/g/o) represent?
  2. What does execute mean on a directory?
  3. What is the difference between symbolic and numeric chmod?
  4. What is a symbolic link?
  5. What does the sticky bit do on a shared directory?
